groupedstats 0.0.5.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Model summary from grouped analysis of any function that has data argument in its function call.

Source: R/grouped_glance.R
grouped_glance.Rd

This is the most general form of a grouped_ function where any function can be used to run grouped_ analysis.

grouped_glance(data, grouping.vars, ..f, ...)

Arguments

data

Dataframe from which variables are to be taken.
grouping.vars

List of grouping variables.
..f

A function, or function name as a string.
...

Arguments to function.

These dots support tidy-dots features.

Examples

groupedstats::grouped_glance(
  data = ggplot2::diamonds,
  grouping.vars = c(cut, color),
  formula = price ~ carat * clarity,
  ..f = stats::lm
)
#> # A tibble: 35 x 13
#> # Groups:   cut, color [35]
#>    cut   color r.squared adj.r.squared sigma statistic   p.value    df logLik

#>  2 Fair  E         0.917         0.912  883.      179. 8.70e-106    14 -1830.
#>  3 Fair  F         0.917         0.912  954.      217. 9.37e-150    16 -2575.

#>  7 Fair  J         0.955         0.950  907.      204. 1.82e- 66    12  -973.
